definition[0]: a big mass or shape of something
example[0]: the great bulk of a building
definition[1]: the size of something or someone
example[1]: The dough will rise until it is double in bulk.
definition[2]: bulk goods are sold or moved in large quantities
definition[3]: the main or largest part of something
example[3]: The change in the tax system will affect the bulk of the population.
example[4]: The bulk of the meetings would be held in Washington.
definition[4]: if you buy, sell, or make something in bulk, you buy, sell, or make large amounts of it
example[5]: Small traders are unable to compete with larger companies which buy and sell in bulk.
example[6]: a bulk shipment of medical supplies
definition[5]: stored loose, not packed in containers
example[7]: the first grain warehouse at the docks for the storage of grain in bulk
